alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:17PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Phillips, Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 917 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Mosby, or 32 miles east of Winnett, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Sand Springs, Devils Creek Rec Area, U L Bend Rec Area, Edwards, Mosby, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Petrolia Lake, Valentine, Steve Fork and Cat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
